title: ‚ÄòLost control at 160 kmph‚Äô: How Bengaluru joyride turned fatal for 6 teens

title: India's air power on display! PM Modi lands at Dibrugarh emergency landing facility, attends IAF show
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Assam for a day-long visit, commencing with an aerial display by the Indian Air Force. He is set to inaugurate the Kumar Bhaskar Varma Setu, the first extradosed bridge in Northeast India, and the temporary campus of IIM Guwahati.

title: '$100,000 deal': What US justice department reveals about Pannun murder plot
content: An Indian national, Nikhil Gupta, has admitted guilt in a US court for orchestrating a $100,000 murder-for-hire plot against a US citizen. Prosecutors allege an Indian government employee directed the scheme targeting a Sikh separatist leader. Gupta's arrest in the Czech Republic led to his extradition and subsequent plea.

title: 'Don‚Äôt think Abhishek is technically sound': Amir sparks fresh controversy
content: Former Pakistan pacer Mohammad Amir mocked Abhishek Sharma ahead of the India-Pakistan T20 World Cup clash, calling him a ‚Äúslogger‚Äù and questioning his technique. Abhishek is recovering from a serious stomach infection, with India captain Suryakumar Yadav giving a cautious fitness update, while Varun Chakravarthy sounded optimistic. Abhishek has travelled to Colombo and will undergo final fitness tests before the match.

title: B'desh polls: Hardliner Jamaat's gains along India border set off security concerns
content: Alarm bells ring for India as hardline Jamaat-e-Islami and allies secure significant wins in Bangladesh border regions. This surge, the party's best in over two decades, fuels concerns about radicalization on both sides of the India-Bangladesh frontier. BJP highlights the historical ties between Jamaat and Pakistan, raising security anxieties for New Delhi.

title: Bill Gates is reportedly selling the house for which he earlier said 'I like this'
content: Bill Gates has listed a four-bedroom home near his Seattle-area estate for $4.8 million, a move that contrasts with his previous statements about not downsizing. The property, purchased in 1995 for $1 million, is part of a larger portfolio of Medina real estate acquired over decades to ensure privacy around his main Xanadu 2.0 compound.

title: Happy valentine's day: 51 best valentine's day wishes and messages
content: Valentine's Day 2026 is here, a perfect occasion to celebrate love in all its forms. Whether you're expressing affection to a girlfriend, boyfriend, husband, or wife, the article offers a collection of heartfelt wishes. It also acknowledges singles embracing self-love and those celebrating with friends and family, encouraging everyone to pause and connect.

title: 'Master at telling lies': Rahul slams PM Modi over India-US trade deal
content: Rahul Gandhi slammed the India-US trade deal, calling PM Modi 'Narendra Surrender Modi' and warning of harm to cotton farmers and textile exporters. He alleged a trap where India faces an 18% tariff on garments while Bangladesh gets 0% by importing US cotton, potentially hurting Indian farmers. Minister Piyush Goyal refuted these claims, stating farmers' interests are protected.

title: V-Day brings cheers for Q-comm brands: More shopping for jewellery, cards, and plush toys
content: Valentine's Day is driving a significant sales surge for quick commerce platforms and digital-first brands, with categories like sexual wellness, jewelry, and fashion experiencing substantial year-on-year growth.  Companies are activating special features and curated lists to capture increased demand, noting a shift towards planned, thoughtful gifting throughout Valentine's week.

title: India vs Pakistan: Where will the contest be won (or lost); what are the chances of rain?
content: Pakistan‚Äôs five-prong spin attack will be a challenge for India on a double-paced pitch at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo. Pakistan are likely to go with an all-spin attack against India. In that case, Sunday‚Äôs fixture will be crucial for Shivam Dube, who has been included in the side to take down spinners.

title: Cisco president Jeetu Patel says company will never hire these developers
content: Cisco's president Jeetu Patel mandates AI for all developers, aiming for half a dozen AI-coded products by 2026. This shift to spec-driven development sees human teams shrink, with AI agents tripling output. While embracing AI's potential, Cisco is investing heavily in security to prevent rogue agents, urging developers to master AI to stay relevant.

title: Graduated from IIT Madras in 2025: 22-yr-old Indian-origin student reported missing in US
content: Berkeley police are urgently seeking help to find Saketh Sreenivasaiah, a 22-year-old Indian Master's student from UC Berkeley, last seen Tuesday.  Authorities consider him an at-risk missing person.  Sreenivasaiah, who studied at IIT Madras, is described as 6'1" with short black hair and brown eyes.  Anyone with information is urged to contact law enforcement immediately.

title: Watch: Hardik spotted with girlfriend; Arshdeep dances on India's arrival in Colombo
content: Team India received a colourful welcome in Colombo ahead of the T20 World Cup clash with Pakistan, with Arshdeep Singh‚Äôs dance going viral and Hardik Pandya arriving with girlfriend Mahieka Sharma. India will rely on key players like Ishan Kishan, Suryakumar Yadav, Tilak Varma and Hardik, while Varun Chakravarthy could be crucial on spin-friendly Sri Lankan pitches.

title: Mahashivratri 2026: The most sacred items to offer to the Shivalinga
content: Mahashivratri, celebrated on February 15th, 2025, is a significant Hindu festival honoring Lord Shiva. Devotees express gratitude and seek blessings by offering sacred items like Bel Patra, water, Gangajal, sandalwood paste, honey, Dhatura, and white flowers. These offerings are believed to cleanse sins, purify the soul, and bring peace, love, and happiness into one's life.

title: This woman still gets Valentine‚Äôs flowers from her husband who died in 2017
content: Years after her husband John passed away, Diana Maver still receives a special Valentine's Day bouquet. John meticulously planned this surprise before his death, ensuring Diana would continue to receive her favorite red roses and white lilies annually. This thoughtful gesture, now carried out by their daughters, serves as a poignant reminder of their enduring love.

title: Slain Hindu man Dipu Das‚Äô kin votes in Bangladesh, calls for justice, accountability from new govt
content: A family in Mymensingh cast their votes hoping for justice after their son, Dipu Chandra Das, was burnt alive last December. Dipu, a garment worker, was attacked by a mob over alleged blasphemy. His father expressed hope that the newly elected government will expedite the justice process for his son.

title: After CEO asked employees to stop coding, Nvidia engineers get access to OpenAI's Codex
content: Nvidia has deployed OpenAI's Codex AI coding tool to all 30,000 engineers, marking a significant enterprise rollout. CEO Jensen Huang's mandate to automate tasks with AI is driving this adoption, with engineers praising the tool's ability to handle complex workflows and maintain context.

title: 'Don 3' dispute: Producers Guild plans sit-down over Ranveer Singh‚ÄìFarhan Akhtar issue
content: A significant dispute has erupted between Ranveer Singh and Farhan Akhtar's production house over 'Don 3'. Following Singh's exit, the filmmakers are reportedly seeking ‚Çπ40 crore in compensation for pre-production expenses. The Producers Guild of India is set to mediate an informal meeting, with a potential escalation to CINTAA if a resolution isn't reached within ten days.

title: 'Likely caused by strangulation': Doctor who observed Epstein autopsy makes shock claim
content: Newly released Justice Department files reignite questions surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in a New York jail cell.  Despite being on suicide watch and under heightened surveillance, significant lapses in protocol occurred, including missed inmate counts and unreplaced cellmates.  The circumstances of his death remain a subject of scrutiny.

title: Chaos, courts, and kickoff: The ISL season that almost wasn‚Äôt
content: After months of administrative chaos, legal battles and uncertainty, the 2025‚Äì26 Indian Super League (ISL) season finally begins five months late. Despite disputes over league structure and governance, clubs, players and stakeholders ensured the competition survived. Yet unresolved issues, including relegation and ongoing legal challenges, mean the drama off the pitch may continue alongside the football.

title: Update! India, Pakistan to hold separate training sessions ahead of mega T20 WC clash
content: India and Pakistan will train at different times in Colombo before their T20 World Cup clash, with both teams also holding media interactions. Team India received a festive welcome, with Arshdeep Singh‚Äôs dance going viral. India will rely on key players like Hardik Pandya, Ishan Kishan, and Tilak Varma, while Varun Chakravarthy could be crucial on spin-friendly Sri Lankan pitches.

title: Before Pak clash, Harbhajan warns India about one player - 'Play him safely'
content: Former Indian cricketer Harbhajan Singh backed India to beat Pakistan in the T20 World Cup but warned they must play spinner Usman Tariq carefully. Tariq‚Äôs bowling action has sparked controversy despite his strong T20 record. Nayan Mongia also predicted an India win, citing team confidence and Pakistan‚Äôs pressure, and backed Hardik Pandya to perform well in big matches.

title: ‚ÄòBring back the king‚Äô: Why Nepal is calling for return of the monarchy
content: Thousands rallied for Nepal's former king, Gyanendra Shah, demanding monarchy restoration outside Kathmandu airport. Supporters chanted slogans and offered flowers, despite prohibitory orders. This resurgence follows economic distress and political instability, with pro-monarchy groups aiming to influence upcoming March elections. Many Nepalis express frustration with the republic's unfulfilled promises.

title: Shahid Kapoor's ‚ÄòO‚ÄôRomeo‚Äô opens with Rs 8.25 crore
content: ‚ÄòO‚ÄôRomeo,‚Äô starring Shahid Kapoor and Triptii Dimri, has opened to a decent Rs 8.25 crore on its first day. The film, a dark tale of love and passion, is expected to see a surge in collections over the weekend. Its opening day occupancy reached 14.86%, with night shows recording the highest footfall.

title: ‚ÄòCome identify your child‚Äô: Secret dawn drive turns fatal for six boys in Bengaluru
content: Six Bengaluru boys met a tragic end in a pre-dawn car crash, leaving grieving families in shock. Parents, believing their sons were studying, were unaware of a secret late-night outing. The devastating news arrived via police calls, shattering their trust and revealing a joyride that ended in tragedy.

title: IndiGo plans to hire over 1,000 pilots after December's crew crunch
content: India's largest airline, IndiGo, is hiring over 1,000 pilots to address operational disruptions caused by pilot shortages. The recruitment drive follows a December incident where over 5,000 flights were cancelled. The airline is also adjusting network planning and increasing standby crew to manage its rapid fleet expansion.

title: Bangladesh polls: After Hasina, Delhi gears up for new regime in Dhaka
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated BNP chief Tarique Rahman on his party's election victory, signaling a shift in New Delhi's approach. While endorsing the poll process, India faces new security concerns with the rise of Jamaat-e-Islami. New Delhi aims to strengthen bilateral ties, focusing on peace, progress, and shared development goals.

title: Woman‚Äôs body found in trunk in Bhopal water tank; live-in partner, mother and siblings held
content: In a shocking incident, Bhopal police have arrested a live-in partner and three family members after a woman's decomposed body was discovered in a trunk within a water tank. The accused allegedly murdered the woman, concealed the body at their residence for a day, and then attempted to dispose of it.

title: Hardik Pandya's dressing-room advice that revived Ishan Kishan's career
content: Following his match-winning knock against Namibia, Ishan Kishan revealed Hardik Pandya's advice to focus on domestic cricket after losing his BCCI contract. Pandya urged Kishan to let his bat do the talking, a sentiment echoed by Pandya's own experience with fan backlash.

title: Patrick Mahomes and Brittany Mahomes make $1M move before season
content: Patrick Mahomes, the Kansas City Chiefs‚Äô star player, is fully focused on recovering from his brutal injuries, after recording a pretty tough time on the field in the last season. As he focuses on his recovery, Patrick Mahomes and his wife, Brittany Mahomes, just pulled off a million dollar move, away from the world of NFL, which has now broken records.

title: Team Canada rules out Brad Marchand, Josh Morrissey vs Switzerland
content: Team Canada faces Switzerland at the 2026 Winter Olympics without key players Josh Morrissey and Brad Marchand. Morrissey is sidelined with an undisclosed injury sustained against Czechia, while Marchand's absence remains unexplained. Seth Jarvis is set to make his Olympic debut, replacing Morrissey on the third line, with Travis Sanheim also stepping into the lineup.

title: 'Absolutely vile': Candace Owens accuses Erika Kirk of having strange relationship with a 15-year-old girl
content: A viral post has intensified debate over Candace Owens‚Äô use of the term grooming in reference to a 15 year old. Critic Natly Denise accused Owens of exaggerating the situation, while Owens cited details from her own interview describing limited in person contact and online messages. The clash highlights ongoing tensions over how serious terms are defined and used in public commentary.

title: DAC allows acquisition of Rafale's SCALP, Russian S400 missiles used in Operation Sindoor
content: India's Defence Acquisition Council has approved the purchase of SCALP missiles for Rafale jets and more missiles for the S400 aerial shield system. This move enhances India's defence capabilities. The deal for 114 Rafale jets will see them manufactured outside France, with deliveries starting in 2028.

title: Harvard University Sued Over Documents Linked To Racial Discrimination Probe
content: The Justice Department sued Harvard University for allegedly failing to hand over documents related to investigations into racial discrimination in admissions, the latest legal clash between the Trump administration and the Ivy League institution.

title: 'Strangled, Not Hanged': Doctor Who Observed Epstein Autopsy Makes Big Claim
content: A pathologist, who observed the post-mortem examination of American financier Jeffrey Epstein, has called for a fresh investigation into the death of the convicted sex offender.

title: Mexican Drug Cartel Drones Trigger Laser Strike That Shut Down US Airspace
content: The government's ability to deal with drones that pose a threat on American soil has been questioned this week after the use of a laser designed to shoot down drones near the border in Texas led to the abrupt closure of the airspace over El Paso

title: Cookies To Newspapers: Ukrainian Drones Turn Delivery Agents For Soldiers
content: Most drones on the battlefield create fear because they are usually carrying explosives. But the Vampire drones sound different to Ukrainian soldiers.

title: OpenAI Says Chinese Rival DeepSeek Distilled US AI Models To Gain An Edge
content: OpenAI has warned US lawmakers that its Chinese rival DeepSeek is using unfair and increasingly sophisticated methods to extract results from leading US AI models to train the next generation of its breakthrough R1 chatbot

title: Who Is Sultan Bin Sulayem, Emirati Billionaire Named In Epstein Files
content: Sultan Ahmed bin Sulayem was a renowned businessman, associated with the rise of Dubai as a trade hub, but revelations of his friendship and lewd correspondence with sex offender Jeffrey Epstein have precipitated a sudden fall from grace.

title: The China Factor Behind Northeast's First Emergency Runway On Highway
content: The China factor is one the the key reasons behind the significance of the emergency landing facility (ELF) on the Dibrugarh-Moran stretch of a national highway in Assam.

title: PM Modi Makes Historic Landing Aboard C-130J Aircraft On Assam Highway
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi made a historic landing at northeast's first emergency landing facility aboard C-130J aircraft in Assam's Moran, beginning his one-day tour of the state that is slated to go to polls soon.

title: "I'm Still A Woman Who Stands Tall": French Mass Rape Survivor Gisele Pelicot In Memoir
content: French rape survivor Gisele Pelicot is rebuilding her life after years of secret abuse that culminated in a landmark trial, leaving France and the world stunned.

title: Indian Student Missing In California, Search Enters 5th Day
content: An Indian student has been reported missing in California, prompting a citywide search that has entered its fourth day on Saturday.

title: 70% Bangladeshis Voted 'Yes' To July Charter. What Does It Mean?
content: There was also the national referendum on the implementation of a reform package, which saw a 60.26 per cent voter turnout in Bangladesh, with the 'yes' vote winning a clear majority, the Election Commission announced Friday.

title: BJP Makes Its Mark In Bangladesh Elections, Wins 1 Seat
content: In Bangladesh's 13th General Elections, the Bangladesh Jatiya Party (BJP) secured a single seat, with Andaleeve Rahman Partho winning from the Bhola-1 constituency.

title: Rahul Gandhi Meets Farmers On India-US Deal. "Stage-Managed," Says BJP
content: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi met farmers at his parliament office and listened to their concerns over the India and US framework trade deal. Taking note of the meeting, the BJP called the meeting "stage-managed", "artificial" and "baseless".

title: 2 Anti-India Terror Accused Among 3 Ex-Convicts Who Won Bangladesh Polls
content: Three Bangladeshi leaders have suddenly found themselves to be very lucky. Two of them are from Tarique Rahman's Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP), which won the first national election since the fall of former prime minister Sheikh Hasina.

title: Supreme Court Asks Himachal Pradesh To Hold Local Body Polls By May 31
content: In a significant relief to the Himachal Pradesh government, the Supreme Court on Friday extended from April 30 to May 31 the deadline fixed by the high court for holding polls for local bodies in the state.

title: Who Is Nikhil Gupta, Indian Man Who Plotted Khalistani Terrorist's Murder
content: In a major case announced by US authorities, 54-year-old Nikhil Gupta, an Indian national, has pleaded guilty to plotting the murder of a US citizen in New York City.

title: "Next Stop Hyderabad': Bandi Sanjay Kumar Praises BJP's Karimnagar Civic Win
content: Karimnagar MP and Union Minister Bandi Sanjay Kumar on Friday praised the BJP's victory in the Karimnagar Municipal Corporation elections as "historic", declaring that the party will next target Hyderabad.

title: Indian Man Pleads Guilty To Murder-For-Hire Plot Against Khalistani Terrorist
content: An Indian national has pleaded guilty in the United States to orchestrating a murder-for-hire plot aimed at assassinating a US citizen and Khalistani Terrorist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun in New York City

title: Aviation Watchdog Puts Stricter Breath Analyser Test Norms In Place For Pilots
content: Aviation safety regulator DGCA has put in place stricter breath analyser test requirements for pilots, wherein those found repeatedly violating the norms could even face cancellation of their pilot license, according to a source.

title: Expelled Over Teachers' Meme, Court Allows Student To Take Class 10 Exam
content: The Supreme Court on Friday allowed a minor boy, rusticated from a school in Indore for allegedly circulating an objectionable meme concerning teachers, to appear in the Class 10 examination.
